info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 3:25PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN NORTHUMBERLAND... NORTHERN MONTOUR...SOUTHEASTERN LYCOMING...CENTRAL COLUMBIA AND NORTHEASTERN UNION COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM EDT... At 324 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bloomsburg to near Milton. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Berwick, Milton, Watsontown, Mifflinville, Lightstreet, New Columbia, Allenwood, Jerseytown, Rohrsburg, Iola, Eyers Grove, Waller, Exchange, Delaware Run, Millville, West Milton, Benton, Turbotville, Briar Creek and Orangeville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central and north central Pennsylvania.
